title: Surgery obstruction
summary: In mathematics, specifically in surgery theory, the surgery obstructions define a map θ : N ( X ) → L n ( π 1 ( X ) ) {\displaystyle \theta \colon {\mathcal {N}}(X)\to L_{n}(\pi _{1}(X))} from the normal invariants to the L-groups which is in the first instance a set-theoretic map (that means not necessarily a homomorphism) with the following property when n ≥ 5 {\displaystyle n\geq 5} :
